problem_statement.issue_description:
During peak pallet moves, the AMR intermittently triggers an emergency slow-down due to false-positive obstacle detections on the front LiDAR. This causes stop-and-go behavior, queueing in narrow aisles, and occasional mission aborts.

Log review suggests the issue correlates with reflective shrink-wrap + low-angle scans; the filter thresholds in the current firmware appear too sensitive.
problem_statement.failure_frequency: Intermittent (~1 in 200 missions; higher in reflective aisles)

affected_subsystems: Safety Systems (E-Stop, Collision Avoidance, Speed Limiting)
proposed_change.detailed_description:
1) Firmware update: adjust LiDAR obstacle-cluster filtering to reduce false positives on high-reflectivity returns while preserving safety margins.
2) Sensor mount shim: add a 1.5mm spacer to slightly adjust the LiDAR pitch angle to reduce floor/reflective-wrap artifacts in the near field.
3) Calibration update: re-run factory calibration routine post-shim for affected serials.

affected_components.drawing_specification_changes: Update DRW-LDR-22-008 Rev C → Rev D to include shim + torque note.
affected_components.software_version_changes: nav-fw v3.8.2 → v3.8.3 (LiDAR filter threshold + reflective return handling)

proposed_change.justification: Reduces stop-and-go events and mission aborts in customer sites with reflective packaging, improving throughput and reducing support tickets. Change is low risk and can be rolled out via OTA for firmware plus a simple field shim where required.

safety_impact.safety_description: The change modifies perception filtering used by collision avoidance. Safety validation and regression testing are required to ensure detection performance remains within spec.
safety_impact.safety_systems_affected: Collision avoidance / speed limiting; perception pipeline thresholds

performance_impact.navigation_accuracy: No change expected; verify in localization regression
performance_impact.reliability_mtbf: Expected improvement (reduced mission aborts); target +10% MTBF for perception faults

field_retrofit.units_affected: Approx. 320 deployed units in reflective-wrap customer environments

supply_chain.lead_time_impact: Shim can be sourced internally; <2 weeks for first batch
supply_chain.moq_considerations: MOQ 500 units if externalized; otherwise printed/in-house cut

cost_analysis.inventory_obsolescence: $0 (no hard replacement of existing LiDAR assemblies)
cost_analysis.field_retrofit_costs: $12,000 (labor + travel estimate for affected sites where shim is required)
cost_analysis.certification_compliance_costs: $0 (no new certifications expected; safety doc update only)
cost_analysis.expected_savings_benefits: Reduced support tickets + downtime; est. $60k/year support savings across top customers

implementation_plan.effectivity_point_value: SN 0450-2100 and later (firmware OTA); shim retrofit for flagged sites only
